alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 12:10PM EDT until September 30 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR BERKELEY AND CHARLESTON COUNTIES... At 1204 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated widespread heavy rain in association with Hurricane Ian. A tropical rain band will continue to move inland this afternoon which will produce heavy rain and near hurricane force wind gusts around McClellanville. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have already fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Highway 17 may see overflowing ditches, leading to area of significant water on the road surface from Awendaw to McClellanville. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mount Pleasant, McClellanville, Daniel Island, Isle Of Palms, Sullivan`s Island, Awendaw, Garris Landing, Bull Island, Price Inlet, Capers Inlet, Mount Pleasant Regional Airport, Wando, Cainhoy, Lighthouse Island, Cape Romain, Hampton Plantation State Park, Boone Hall Plantation, Cape Island, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre and Santee Coastal Reserve. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is likely in low-lying coastal areas where high tide will inhibit runoff of heavy rain.
